short_summary: Canada is seeking a transportable utility building for general storage.
description: Today, the Minister of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) intends to issue a request for proposals from qualified Offerors for a Portable Utility Building for the Department of National Defence. The building must have with an engineering concrete block foundation designed for the name opening storage and warehouse facility \. Here is the full documentation description
full_summary: ============== **Notice Title** Portable Utility Building Tender (W3555-243782) **Tender Number** WS4411322737-Doc4623905057 **Tender Status** The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites interested suppliers to submit offers for a portable utility building with an engineered concrete block foundation for general storage and warehousing to the Department of National Defence. **Key Tender Information** * **Notice Type**: Request for Proposal (RFP) * **Procurement Method**: Competitive – Open Bidding * **Selection Criteria**: Variations or combinations of the above methods * **Contract Term**: Not specified, but expected contract end date is March 31, 2025 * **Regions of Delivery**: British Columbia * **Point of Contact** + Name: Aleksandra Karpik (SPAC/PSPC) + Email: aleksandra.karpik@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca + Phone: Not available **Notice Details** A tender notice is available on the Canadian Government’s procurement portal, Bank of Allen enterprise wide portal, (https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19955576). The tender closing date is July 9, 2024, at 2:00 pm EST. Please note that this tender has expired and no further submissions will be accepted. **Bid Submission Requirements** Suppliers must submit their bids electronically through the online system linked above. Bids must include all necessary documentation as outlined in the tender specifications. **Industry Classification** This tender is classified under UNSPSC 30000000, which includes Structures and Building, Construction, and Manufacturing Components and Supplies. **Language of Communication** All communications related to this tender will be conducted in English and French. Suppliers are responsible for ensuring their bid submissions are in both languages. **Suppliers are encouraged to review the tender notice and attached documents thoroughly before submitting their bid.**
